oracle.apps.saf.ta.jaudit.core
Class AbstractAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
  oracle.jdeveloper.audit.analyzer.Analyzer
      oracle.apps.saf.ta.jaudit.core.AbstractAnalyzer
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractJboAnalyzer, AbstractUrlAnalyzer, AbstractXmlAnalyzer
public abstract class AbstractAnalyzer
extends oracle.jdeveloper.audit.analyzer.Analyzer

The core base class for Analyzers in SAF All SAF based analyzers must extend from this class. It provides support for annotation based visitor enablement based on the Workspace and Project.

See Also:
AuditWorkspace, AuditProject

getProjectFacade

protected oracle.apps.ta.dt.core.model.facades.ProjectFacade getProjectFacade()
These methods that they should not be called directly by concrete subclasses. They are only for Abstract framework classes use as they may or may not be null at different times. Concrete classes should always gain access through a method parameter provided to them.

Returns:
The current ProjectFacade

getRules

public oracle.jdeveloper.audit.analyzer.Rule[] getRules()
This method is called by the Addin that initializes the extension using this framework. This is the java based registration approach, which takes an analyzer. This method then returns the Rule instances on the current analyzer that should be registered. We do not want to return any superclass pseudo-rules as they would be registered over and over again, and they don't need to be registered for their purposes which are only for reporting.

Overrides:
getRules in class oracle.jdeveloper.audit.analyzer.Analyzer
Returns:
Rule objects on this analyzer.

protected oracle.apps.ta.dt.core.model.facades.WorkspaceFacade getWorkspaceFacade()

Returns:
The current WorkspaceFacade

ruleEnabled

public boolean ruleEnabled(oracle.jdeveloper.audit.analyzer.Rule rule)
Convenience method to detect if a rule is enabled. Safe to invoke with null.

Parameters:
rule -
Returns:
true if the rule is not null and is enabled.
